member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.remarks: Affix and dictionary data must be binary loaded Hunspell dictionaries.

member.name: M:NHunspell.Hunspell.Add(System.String)
member.summary: Adds the specified word to the internal dictionary.
member.returns: true if the word was successfully added, otherwise false
member.remarks: The word is NOT added to the dictionary file or data or stored in some way. It is only added to the internal data of the current class. You must store your user dictionary elsewhere and Add() all words every time you create a new object.

member.name: M:NHunspell.Hunspell.AddWithAffix(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Adds the specified word to the internal dictionary. Determines the affixes from the provided sample.
member.returns: true if the word was successfully added, otherwise false

remarks.para: The affixiation is determined by the example. The added word should have the stem form

The word is NOT added to the dictionary file or data or stored in some way. It is only added to the internal data of the current
class. You must store your user dictionary elsewhere and Add() all words every time you create a new
object.

member.example: bool spellBefore = hunspell.Spell("phantasos"); spellBefore = hunspell.Spell("phantasoses"); add = hunspell.AddWithAffix("phantasos","fish"); // this fantasy word is affixed like the word fish ( plural es ...) spellAfter = hunspell.Spell("phantasos"); spellAfter = hunspell.Spell("phantasoses"); // the plural (like fish) is also correct

member.returns: List of stems and the according morphology

member.name: P:NHunspell.Hunspell.NativeDllPath
member.summary: Gets or sets the path to the native Hunspell DLLs.

remarks.para: This property can only be set before the first use of NHunspell.
NHunspell uses specialized DLLs with platform specific names. Hunspellx86.dll is the 32Bit X86 version, Hunspellx64.dll is the 64Bit AMD64 version.

member.name: P:NHunspell.Hunspell.IsDisposed
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether is disposed.
